title: unesco_heritage_Rangiri_Dambulla_Cave_Temple
text:
Name: Rangiri Dambulla Cave Temple. short_description:

A sacred pilgrimage site for 22 centuries, this cave monastery, with its five sanctuaries, is the largest, best-preserved cave-temple complex in Sri Lanka. The Buddhist mural paintings (covering an area of 2,100 m2 ) are of particular importance, as are the 157 statues.

. date_inscribed: 1991. danger: 0. date_end: . longitude: 80.64916667. latitude: 7.856666667. area_hectares: 0. category_long: Cultural. category_short: C. Country name: Sri Lanka. Region: Asia and the Pacific. iso_code: lk. transboundary: 0. rev_bis: .
